data.title: Delicious and Fresh
data.text: Don't let the stripmall fool you! The food is delicious and fresh. The service is laid back...so you should be too! Nice place to have a leisurely meal.

data.title: Don't let the looks deter you !
data.text: Friends who live in Lincoln invited us to Sinbad's, an Iraqi Restaurant they bragged was very good and very authentic. They were right on! The lack of ambience, uikka niformed servers, and plain tables, chairs, flooring, and fluorescent lights were more than compensated by the luscious food we were served. It clearly came directly from the grill or stove, and was absolutely wonderful. We had a variety of Baba Ghanouj, kebabs (beef and chicken) tikka chicken, Kubba, and awesome salads. The service was prompt and unobtrusive. The Lentil soup was delicious. We were too full for the wonderful choice of desserts offered.

data.title: Nice experience
data.text: Found Sinbad's on the Internet and decided to give it a try since we enjoy middle eastern cuisine. Outside was a little intimidating for someone visiting Lincoln and not familiar with the area. Once inside we were treated to a wonderful experience. Dishes were tasty and portions were very generous!  Reminded me of restaurants I have visited in the Middle East. I would definitely recommend you give this place a try!

data.title: Simply outstanding
data.text: This is a dinky but totally outstanding restaurant near Holdredge street and east campus UNL. The hummus was delicious and not too garlicky. The falafel was amazing. Best I have had. Chicken kebabs were tender and flavorful. I would have liked more vegetables. The eggplant soup was out of this world. Free Iraqi tea. The food came quite quickly after we ordered. Service is not the best, but the atmosphere is very informal which is part of the charm, and you can go up and ask for anything you need. If you want "fancy" this is not the place. If you want amazing food give this place a try.

data.title: Fabulous food...a gem
data.text:
This is an absolute hidden gem located in a nondescript, tiny strip mall. The chicken kabab (large), was delicious with tons of tender chicken. It came with rice and soup. Lentil soup and the eggplant soup were very good; large bowl too! 

Their falafels are outstanding...the best I have every had. Tasty and crispy. Bread was wonderful too. 

Serve yourself some good Iraqi tea...all you can drink. 

They have both an Arabic TV and English TV going. 

Service is a bit spotty, but this is more than compensated by the cosy atmosphere (bring a sweater...it can get cold inside in winter!), and delicious food.

data.title: Yummy!!
data.text:
We just happened into this restaurant while in the area visiting.  We had the Sinbad combo, which was plenty for the two of us.  The falafel were really delicious and they aren't something either of us had been especially fond of before.  The chicken and beef were also very tasty, and we loved the sauce that came with the dish.  The meal was served on a bed of seasoned rice with peas and other veggies, and with a couple pieces of puffy bread.  The meal also came with a bowl of soup.  We had the lentil soup, which we both enjoyed.  There were several other soups to choose from, our only regret is that we didn't get to try some of the others.

After our meal we chatted with the owner (we assume) for a while, and that was very nice.

The only reason we didn't it 5 stars is that things were a little slow, but there was a sign on the door they were looking for wait staff.  So for the near term you might want  to be a little little patient, as the short wait will be worth it.

data.title: Cult restaurant great food. Friendly. Love the eggplant soup, Iraqi bread. Salad very fresh.
data.text: Very good food and very reasonable. Nearly always ther are Arabic men eating along with college professors who value good food, a bit of culture and value.
